summary: This bill, known as the Hearing Protection Act, aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code and Title 18 of the United States Code concerning firearm silencers. Key provisions include removing silencers from the definition of firearms, effectively treating them similarly to other firearms under the law. It addresses taxation, registration, and state laws related to silencers. The bill also mandates the destruction of silencer registration records and modifies sections of title 18 to clarify definitions and regulations, including serial number requirements for manufacturers. Finally, the bill imposes a tax on firearm silencers and mufflers.
